name: ringer
content:
ringer noun [C]
(SOUND)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a thing that makes a ringing sound, especially part of a mobile phone: Turn off the phone's ringer by flipping the switch. Other buttons include a volume rocker on the left, with a slider that turns the ringer off.
someone who rings a bell: The church ringers meet for practice every Wednesday evening. The doorbell ringer turned out to be my aunt. See also
bell ringer

ringer noun [C]
(IN SPORTS/GAMES)
a person or horse that takes part in a competition, game, or race illegally or unfairly, for example by someone pretending that they are another person or horse: They had a ringer on their team - someone who usually plays for a team in a different league. The under-9 team's star player was a ringer: he was two years older than the other kids. Ringer scandals, in which one horse runs under the name of another, have a long and colourful history.
US in various games, a ring or horseshoe that lands around the target that is being aimed at: He said the game was very stressful because you felt you needed to throw a ringer every time. The top-ranked player entering the event throws a ringer on an average of 88 percent of his tosses.

ringer noun [C]
(SIMILAR)
someone or something that looks very similar to someone or something else: With his top hat and red nose, he is a ringer for W. C. Fields. His drawing of a circle of dancing women is a ringer for Matisse's Dancers. Synonym
dead ringer
